Reviews.Title: “Good, Clean and Cheap Stay”
Reviews.Author: Chris N
Reviews.Content: Rooms were very clean and the location is convenient for the area. Continental breakfast offers cereals, and make your own waffles. The rooms were quiet but the sheets and blankets are VERY Thin. Rooms are small and not well lit.

Reviews.Title: “Far exceeded expectations!”
Reviews.Author: grmmaof6
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as part of a package from the Museum of Science and Industry website, which included 2 adult tickets. The pricing seemed so reasonable for downtown Chicago that I wasn't expecting too much. What a pleasant surprise! This hotel is within easy walking distance from Union Station. It was after 10:00 p.m. on a weeknight and we felt completely safe on our short jaunt. I noticed several restaurants near Union Station. The hotel appears to have been recently remodeled, and everything was bright and clean. Our room had a nice-sized bathroom and ample space in the main room. They do not offer rollaways, and our sleeping arrangements put our 12-yr-old grandson on the floor using extra blankets, but this was our choice and the carpeting and baseboards were spotlessly clean and there was plenty of floorspace. I didn't notice street noise (but we do always travel with a whitenoise machine.) The free full breakfast was one of the best we've ever come upon -- very spacious seating area and 2 long bars with waffles, eggs, bacon, sausage, fruit, cereal, yogurt, etc. We didn't use the pool but checked it out - it was a small basic rectangular pool. The front desk staff was pleasant, professional and helpful. The next morning we chose to walk about 5 blocks to a bus stop after getting day passes at a nearby Walgreens. There was a stop closer, but rather than do a transfer we did a little walking. Excellent stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Price and Location”
Reviews.Author: Mike M
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a family for 3 nights in July for a short vacation to check out Chicago and a Cubs game. We chose this hotel based on its location, price and that it had both a pool and complimentary full breakfast. A combination hard to find in the downtown. Checkin was quick and easy. Our room was very clean and updated. It was somewhat small but not cramped. Although we overlooked busy Franklin St from only 4 floors up the room was surprisingly quiet. The bathroom was spotless. The free wifi came in handy for looking up restaurants and attractions on our cell phones. The free full hot breakfast buffet was great with lots of selection, friendly staff and plenty of seating. My kids loved the fresh waffles. The front desk staff were very helpfull and accomodating when asked "tourist" questions. The pool was very small but still refreshing and came in handy as we were there during a brutal heat wave. My kids enjoyed there daily swims. The hotel is very conveniently located. We arrived by train and had a hard time flagging a cab. We ended up walking from Central Station with our luggage in tow as it was only a few blocks from the station. Even with luggage and two young girls it only took about 10 mins to walk to the hotel. It is just a couple blocks from the Willis Tower (Sears Tower). The hotel is also located right at the El train loop with one of the stations only a block away. This is were all the El train routes converge in a loop in downtown Chicago. From here you can get to just about anywhere in Chicago on the El. There are plenty of eateries, pubs, drug stores, coffee shops all within a short walk. As a side note we visited the Shedd Aquarium, Navy Pier for the weekly fireworks, Wrigley Field, the Silver Bean, Miracle Mile and the Skydeck at Willis Tower. All were very interesting and enjoyable. The kids especially loved the aquarium, a must if you have kids. We ate at the original Billy Goat Tavern (home of the SNL skit "cheeseborger,cheeseborger) located below street level on the Miracle Mile and one of the Giordanos restaurants. The burgers at the Billy Goat are ok but the atmosphere is a must experience. The deep dish at Giordanos was unbelievable, a must try. For the price, location, amenities and convenience this hotel would be tough to beat.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE IT!”
Reviews.Author: Dragana W
Reviews.Content: When I got there I realized I wasn't in a room where the bed was separate from the living area which is a MUST for me having a child. They corrected it immediately. I was VERY satisfied with my room. The bed was amazing, they had a crib for my daughter. The room is very updated and clean. I loved it. They only thing I didn't like is it was expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago weekend”
Reviews.Author: Brenda D Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the staff were all very courteous and helpful the complimentary breakfast was very good, lots of good choices, the food/beverages are all laid out well for people to walk through out the room the room was fine, one stand out would be the thermostat control for heat/cool.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: CanuckEMC2
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a reasonable hotel to stay in while staying in Chicago and wanted something in the downtown area. We used hotwire for the first time when booking and, after deciding based on price and hotel rating, booked the hotel. With hotwire you don't know the exact hotel until the transaction has been complete. When our reservation was confirmed the name of the hotel La Quinta, was disclosed. We had never stayed in a La Quinta hotel before and we were very happy with what we experienced. The room was very spacious, spotless and had a very large window that made the room very bright. The breakfast that was included in the cost of the room was wonderful with lots of choice. Quite a variety of cereals, fresh fruit and fruit salad, yogurts, waffle station, bagels, toast, muffins, coffee, tea, juices. We will most definitely stay at La Quinta again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, atmosphere and breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Marielitas
Reviews.Content: The location is the best: in the middle of downtown, you can walk to the office, to the millenium park, do shopping and have fun. All was great. What I enjoyed the most was the breakfast area in the 2nd floor: big windows, beautiful decoration, you can feel Chicago is welcoming you!

Reviews.Title: “Frequent stay!”
Reviews.Author: Mike R
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this LQ a million times, all stays have been great! Staff is extremely friendly and helpful. The rooms are always clean and I put a request for a room with great downtown view, staff has been giving me that for no extra charge! WAY HAPPY OVER ANY BRAND HOTEL IN WINDY CITY!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: number10Toledo_ohio
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is located in the business district (river South) but not a bad walk or short cab ride to anything in town. I stayed at this hotel Oct 2011 for business and an extened weekend. I got a king room for $115.00 a nite thru Expedia. The Hotel was clean and comfy. No bussers or bells. The staff at the free breakfast bar were terrific. Extremely helpful and funny. It made the day get off to a great start. Parking is at the garage next door so it is convienent. However, like most lots in Chicago, it is pricey. IF you can find this Hotel on line for under $115.00 it not a bad deal tho there are other places a bit cheaper if you shop around. Obviouly ,the sooner u book, the better the price. AND, my favorite "DIVE BAR" Stocks and Blondes is just around the corner. Got to check it out.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: Rwindh
Reviews.Content: I stayed here once last year and I don't recall anything bad about the stay. This time around things are different. The room looks like something out of an Ikea catalog. Not bad but definitely not homey. It's very dorm-like. The bathroom is spacious but the toilet keeps running and they can't fix it until tomorrow. They did offer to move my room when I reported it but I was already completely unpacked and tired and that would have been too big a hassle at that point. The shower also smells like mold. It looks clean but something isn't right in there. There was a mark from a glass on the bathroom countertop that I didn't put there so I'm not very confident about the meticulousness of the maids. Oh, and you can clearly hear the elevated train each time it goes by. Overall it's alright. It isn't great but it will do. I have to stay here several more times in the next few weeks for business so I hope it's just this room and not the entire property. Time will tell.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient downtown location just west of the Loop”
Reviews.Author: TheatreGeek53704
Reviews.Content: Depending on the price you can get, this is a great alternative for the theatre district, the opera, or any other activities situated toward the west side of the loop. The room I had was amazingly spacious, especially for accommodations in a big city. Huge work area looking out the windows, very comfortable bed, mini fridge, and coffee maker. My one quibble: it would have been nice to have an easy chair situated for reading and watching TV... there certainly is room. Also very friendly and efficient staff.

Reviews.Title: “New, clean, and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: bimarian
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location for anyone working near the Sears Tower or the western part of the Loop. Since it was built a few years ago I've stayed here on business trips a few times a year. It's definitely the nicest La Quinta property I've ever seen. It's practically brand-new, which shows in the cleanliness and the condition of the rooms, and the staff are friendly and helpful. The free breakfast, although certainly not gourmet, is extensive (waffles, eggs, sausages, fruit, the usual spread of cereal, bread, and pastries) and is a great help when you're rushing off to the office.

Reviews.Title: “Serves the purpose”
Reviews.Author: denham_10
Reviews.Content: We use this hotel for business trips that require little hotel time and just a place to sleep. Not only with the La Quinta membership are the rooms always clean, modern and with a good desk, we also get good rates. The breakfast is basic but will keep you going until lunch. No social area for business meetings but the clean, cheap room makes it a useful choice for the business traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Great potential but serious flaw”
Reviews.Author: juliab26
Reviews.Content: Four of us were in Chicago for an important business meeting beginning at 8AM. We live approximately 2-3 hours from Chicago and decided to travel to Chicago the night before so that we could get a good night's sleep. The meeting location was only 2 blocks from the hotel. Three of us were put in rooms 209, 213, 215, respectively...the fourth one (and the only male in the group) was put on the 9th floor. I was very pleased with the hotel in every aspect with the exception of one very glaring and unexcusable flaw...the flags they have mounted directly on the outside of the building where our rooms were located. There are four flags, each with a metal bar attached to the flag that kept the flag somewhat straight and likely prolongs the time it takes for the flags ends to become tattered and torn. However, between the rattling of the poles inside the metal piece that is mounted to the outside of the building and the banging of the metal bars against the building and flag pole, there was so much noise that it was impossible to get any sleep. I tried putting a pillow over my head and moving to the side of the bed that was furthest from the windows but nothing was sufficient to muffle the sound. As a result, none of the three of us staying on that floor got any sleep. This is going to sound like an exaggeration but, trust me, this is the most accurate description I could give it and the two other people staying in rooms down the hall from me agreed...it sounded like a snow plow blade scraping against pavement and attached to the snowplow being dragged along were metal garbage containers being violently banged together. What is most disappointing about this experience is that the clerk checking us in certainly knew there is an issue with the noise from the flags on that side of the building (the reason I have rated the service as poor). This was confirmed when we checked out and all we had to do was mention the flags and we got a sympathetic acknowledgment. We, unexpectedly, ended up needing to stay another night because our meeting ran long. However, we found a different hotel that wasn't as convenient as the location of LaQuinta just because we did not want to risk another sleepless night. Any aesthetic value LaQuinta believes the flags add to the curb appeal of their hotel does not outweigh the value of its guests having a restful sleep. I would only stay there again if the flags were gone or if I could guarantee a room no where near where the flags are located. Without the flag situation, I would have rated this hotel very highly. The rooms were $179 without taxes. This is not an unreasonable rate for a good experience but I have rated the value as low because it was too much to pay for a room that you cannot sleep in.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: cheeseelizee
Reviews.Content: I have to admit, I groaned when my Hotwire hotel was revealed. I have never stayed at La Quinta property, but somehow made the assumptions that all La Quintaâ€™s are â€œcrappyâ€�. Iâ€™m happy to say, I was proven wrong! My husband and I had truly enjoyed our stay. We stayed 4 nights during October 2011. *King Bed Suite: The rooms are clean, spacious and modern. I think this property may have had an update because the paint, furniture and dÃ©cor were in great condition. Our had room many electrical outlets, sofa, flat screen, microwave and mini refrigerator. Average size bathrooms with shower and tub. *Service/Hotel Amenities: The staff was friendly and helpful. No bellhop. Free wifi and breakfast daily. Parking available, but itâ€™s $36 a night :/ There is Cupcake shop and Argo Tea Shop in the lobby. *Location: Great location. The hotel is located in the heart of downtown, so thereâ€™s pros and cons to its location. (The cons were very minimal) -Pros: Walking distance to El train, shops, drug stores and restaurants. 2 blocks away from Sears Tower! -Cons: Business close early. The scene is â€œdeadâ€� during evenings and weekends. Not many bars in the area. *Random Tips: -Giordanosâ€™ Pizza: 4 blocks away from the hotel. The lobby has Giordanoâ€™s coupons. -Car Rental: isnâ€™t needed to explore Chicago, but if you do rent, thereâ€™s an Enterprise located in the hotel parking structure. If you do a day rental, you can avoid the daily parking fee, by returning to car to Enterprise, since they are located in the same structure. -Take a Drive to Wisconsin: As a huge cheese lover, I was over the top giddy when I found out Wisconsin was only an hour away. We rented a car for a day and drove to explore Milwaukee, Wisconsin. The highway from Chicago to Milwaukee has many cheese themed shops and a shopping outlet with 5% sales tax! -Pet Friendly: Throughout my stay I saw a few people checking in with their pets.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything down town!”
Reviews.Author: Gardeninggrandma
Reviews.Content: I reserved 2 rooms from expediaon the 19th of Nov. The rooms had no view what so ever.The rooms were average.The pool was small and very crowded and noisy.The breakfast area was nice with a little bit of everything and the staff did a great job of keeping everything well stocked.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice”
Reviews.Author: daluga_ti
Reviews.Content: I can vouch for the other positive reviews. Hotel was very nice. You won't be disappointed. Rooms were clean and having a fridge and microwave is nice. The complimentary breakfast was put together nicely with many choices available. My view was not good but I wasn't bothered by it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel right downtown!”
Reviews.Author: Anna A
Reviews.Content: Stayed Nov 12. One of out first trips to Chicago. Extremely impressed with all the staff we encountered and the room was fantastic! The hotel is newer so everything was very clean and well decorated. The breakfast was huge and again, was well staff with friendly people. Walking distance to the Shedd and many downtown locations. I would highly recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Fabgurrl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel in September (26-28), 2011 and the location is perfect. Next to a L train stop. Very quiet room. we were at the end of the hall and were upgraded to a room with a conference room attached. (we didn't need it, but it was nice of them to offer). Hotel room is clean, the breakfast was decent. Overall, we would stay there again. Great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: 5Places
Reviews.Content: Booked it on Hotwire. The room was large, with a Keurig coffee maker that made the best in-room cup of coffee I've ever had. Just a block from the loop, friendly staff, breakfast was ok... I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: lildoxis
Reviews.Content: It was an easy in and out. I was impressed by the overall cleanliness of the Hotel!!! The view from the breakfast room was totally relaxing and airy. The room smelled fresh and was very neat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: LeeR81
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great value when staying in the loop. The hotel is fairly new, very clean, and the complementary breakfast is substantial. The Willis (Sears) Tower is a very short walk, as is Union Station, but Millennium Park and Michigan Ave. is about a 15-20 minute walk. The rooms were a little tight and the double beds are smaller than expected, but again, it's a great price for downtown Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Epeg
Reviews.Content: All in all, nice stay and great location in the loop. The hotel is in the shadow of the Sears (Willis) Tower and is within walking distance to Millennium Park, the EL, and a number of other sites essential to a visit to Chicago. My one complaint is that the 'double' beds seemed rather small. I have a double bed at home and this was definitely smaller. The hotel and the rooms were clean and inviting. The staff was friendly and helpful. Overall, good stay and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Limited Breakfast?”
Reviews.Author: Meilaiccad
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a nice place to stay but weekends are limited breakfast. No eggs or bacons. Just sausage when they passed them out in person on Saturday. I think they should serve eggs and bacons in weekends too.

Reviews.Title: “Good downtown location, clean bright atmosphere, free breakfast buffet, very pleased.”
Reviews.Author: OneHappySoul
Reviews.Content: Convenient location in loop area 10 minute safe and easy walk from union station. Pretty close to different shopping areas ... 10-15 minute walk or easy bus ride or short ($7-10) cab ride. Did not have a car but i think they charge about thirty some dollars a night extra for that. The area felt safe, always lots of people around. Ask at the front desk to call a cab if needed or during busier times they can turn on a light on the outside of the building to let cabs driving by know they are needed. Decor is bright, contemporary, pleasant. Everything looked fresh and clean. Arrived early and no rooms available for early check in. Perfectly ok. Came back and waited in comfy lobby, did get to check in a little early but only after I heard other people were checking in early and went back up to the front desk. Front desk crew was cheerful and accommodating. The room was also very clean, fresh, cheerful. The warm lighting in the room is very pleasant to be in, but not very good for putting on make-up. Needed a lighted make-up mirror. Nice big wall mounted TV above the desk, and nice ergonomic desk chair. Free wi-fi in the rooms. Good little fridge and microwave next to nice big drawers and counter top area very handy and functional. Digital room thermostat on the wall made it easy to keep the temp in the room just where I wanted it. Bed was not uber pillow-toppy comfortable, but nicely comfortable with good pillows of different stiffness levels to choose from. Bathroom had just the basics, no designer toiletries, but very clean and really nice shower head. Free breakfast Buffett in a large pretty room. Just the basic food selections, only hard boiled eggs and sausage but other good healthy selections and good staff keeping everything fully stocked even up till the last minute it was open. Nice place, good value, would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “It did the work”
Reviews.Author: sommarcatta
Reviews.Content: In town beacause of the half marathon. The hotel is ok with no frills. Ok sized room with two quite small beds that were supposed to be a double double. The kids were not too thrilled to share the cramped space in the bed. Bathroom ok and clean but bring your own toiletries. Missed breakfast the first morning due to our early start for the marathon but the hotel was nice and offered coffee and toast already from 05:30. Had the regular breakfast the morning after. Coffee, tea, juice, yogurt, eggs, bacon and waffles... Location, well itÂ´s a block from the Sears tower, or Willis tower as it has changed name. ItÂ´s not a vibrant area and feels very businessliked. Had dinner at Italian Village and Volare. Both very good italian restaurants. Italian village is located four blocks away and Volare pretty close to the Trump tower and therefore some distance away. Shopped a lot on FileneÂ´s basement and TJ:Max on East street. Good barguins for everyone from infants to grownups of both genders. Overall if you get a good price donÂ´t hesitate to go. You will end up with a decent and clean hotel

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the city!”
Reviews.Author: karkar51
Reviews.Content: The La Quinta Inn & Suites in Chicago was just perfect in almost every way. The location was fantastic... we walked the 4 blocks from Union Station in less than 5 minutes. The walk to Michigan Ave and Millenium Park was maybe 10 min straight down Madison Ave. There were lots of food options close by. We arrived 2 hours before the official check-in time but our room was ready. Besides the king-sized bed we had a long desk under the window, a spacious shower with granite counters in the bathroom, a small closet, a huge dresser and of course a flat-screened HD tv. There was also a keurig-type coffee system! The entire hotel is new and the staff very friendly and helpful. The free breakfast on the second floor was one of the best I've seen... and really how many hotels in Chicago have complimentary breakfast?? They also offer free wifi throughout the hotel, not only free but very fast. We were impressed. They do have a small pool and small hot tub, could be a problem if the hotel were full and everyone wanted to swim. We were the only ones swimming the night we were there. We did not have a tub in our bathroom, not an issue for us but could be for someone with small children. Perhaps other rooms do have that option. It's hard to find a comfortable hotel within our budget in Chicago without compromising something, however at La Quinta we didn't have to compromise a thing!

Reviews.Title: “Everything was excellent and I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: travelkitty50
Reviews.Content: Staying here for one night the first week of September, we we were warmly greeted and upgraded to a suite without even asking, which was very nice. The bathroom had a glassed in spa shower which felt wonderful after plane and train travel all that day. The room was essentially quiet during the night and we rested well. There was an indoor heated pool which looked good but that we didn't get to. The full breakfast on Sunday morning was really good and unlimited and there was a nice, sunny dining area beside it. I had to print several things off and the business center was quiet and private. The room is very convenient to the El train (half a block) and we were able to walk or to take a bus to everything that we wanted to see that weekend. The Chicago public transit system is very effiicient and we enjoyed our stay in the windy city very much. It is one of the few cities/hotels that I will definitely visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Labor Day weekend in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: mrn0363
Reviews.Content: Great Chicago hotel. Nice, clean and good value. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and staff. Rooms are modern and well-appointed. Nice comp breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: whitcanna
Reviews.Content: Excellent service and hotel. Staff was exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TorontoKimmer
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location right in the Loop. Front desk staff were friendly, knowledgeable, and very helpful making suggestions and reservations. The hotel is brand new and well appointed. The decor is pretty cool for now, but will be dated pretty quickly. Complimentary breakfast was excellent - good variety of choices. Check online for parking discounts at the adjacent 'Poet's Garage'

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: 6101FCD
Reviews.Content: You might be inclined to dismiss a La Quinta in downtown Chicago, but this one is an affordable and clean hotel with a terrific breakfast. It is a relatively new property, in a partly new and partly renovated building. Even many locals do not know it is there. The hotel is well located in the heart of the loop, but really for the business traveler rather than the tourist. Any office building in the Loop is an easy walk. The hotel is located only one block from the Orange Line to Midway and just a few blocks from the Blue Line to O'Hare. Either train ride is easy, other than at rush hour when the train is crowded, but at rush hour you risk the frustration of a taxi where the meter moves faster than the cab's wheels. Staff is friendly and responsive.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel with good free breakfast”
Reviews.Author: potostbo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights for business and after some arguing with the front desk woman and help from her manager they gave me a nice room on the 8th floor (rm 822). The windows had a nice view of Franklin St. The breakfast good and free which is a plus. They provided normal continental breakfast items but also had bacon, eggs and sausage. The last night was the worst because a bunch of kids or adolescent adults checked in because of Lollapalooza and partied all night long. Based on the last night and poor front desk help this hotel gets an average from me.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, Chic & FREE BREAKFAST!”
Reviews.Author: wineworth
Reviews.Content: Love, loved this place! Great location...it was within walking distance to the Taste of Chicago and other attractions. The rooms were updated and clean. Pretty spacey...the bathroom was HUGE! They also served continental breakfast which is always a plus in my book. There was a lot of food choices and the staff was SO friendly! Definately will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Sensational location, fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: taqueeney
Reviews.Content: Such an easy Hotel to get to from the airport. Caught the train into downtown and within an easy stroll with 2 suitcases to a welcoming and happy reception staff and porters. It was pleasing to see the porter recognised our name immediately and raced off to pickup a package that we had sent there a few weeks earlier for pickup. Our first night was not the best besting light sleepers. The room was on the lowest floor facing the alleyway that was serviced (what felt like hourly) by rubbish trucks while trying to sleep. The next morning reception were very accommodating and were able to provide us a very satisfying room that was looking over the quiet driveway, and was almost double the size. The breakfast was always very busy, not a huge range but satisfactory. The second room that we stayed in for 4 days was excellent value. So much so that a American friend who was staying in another hoot, commented while while visiting with baby twins how comfortable the room was. What was so special about this hotel? Simply put, the Porters. They were all a wealth of information, caring, and interested in our daily activities and adventures. Very hard working and I hope they are appropriately remunerated. Thank you. This room was purchased off Hotwire and was excellent value!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice room and friendly staff. We found our Chicago hotel.”
Reviews.Author: kasclark
Reviews.Content: Staff was very friendly. Comfy room and free Internet. Very close to the Washington/Wells metro stop. Although the breakfast was served on disposable plates (in typical American tackiness) it was extensive and tasty. We've stayed at other hotels in Chicago, but this was the best price/quality ratio we've found so far. The great location and all-round good quality of the accommodations will make this our hotel of choice when visiting Chicago in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Clemsonchickie
Reviews.Content: Came here for 3 night Girls Weekend. Booked it on Hotwire so got a great rate. We could not have been more pleased. It was a one block walk from Washington/Wells train stop. Rooms were small but very clean and modern. Only wish there were queen sized beds rather than full size. The breakfast buffet was plentiful with lots of choices and very tasty. The staff was extremely friendly. It was a great location to walk to restaurants and shopping. Also two blocks from Willis Tower and only a few blocks walk to Millenium Park. I have no complaints and highly recommend it. Will stay again next time in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Only the biggest primadonnas would hate this place and you know who you are, you jerks”
Reviews.Author: westmaw
Reviews.Content: For everyone else, however, the La Quinta is a-ok. I find it hilarious when I read reviews on Trip Advisor where people actually complain about things like the in-room coffeemaker. Or street noise. Or people's footsteps in the hall. Why do these individuals come to a place like Chicago in the first place? I had a cup of coffee in my room yesterday and it was adeqaute as hell. I had been up all night the previous evening making street noise and loud footsteps in the hall, and that crummy coffee really tasted good to me. What was better than the coffee, however, was the city of Chicago. It was great in fact. We went to a ballgame, had a nice dinner, got loaded in various bars, watched my cousin accuse a cabdriver of stealing his cellphone (which he most certainly did not do) and more . Chicago held up its end of the weekend good times bargain. So did La Quinta. They provided a clean room in a nice building in a good part of town, with a very edible breakfast in the morning at a price that was 50-100 bucks cheaper than everything else we looked at. Yeah, you can't really go to work on Monday and brag to your buddies about your stay at the La Quinta, but if you're the type of person who does that, La Quinta and I don't want your business (I'm not speaking directly for LaQuinta on this, but I have a feeling that they're with me on this one) anyway. Stay away. Everyone else is welcome and will be comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Bruegger
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for me, my wife and two kids via Hotwire. Good rate. Wanted something close to Millenium park. While not right across the street, it's a comfortable walk. Room was very nice, clean. Staff very friendly. Nice complimentary breakfast. Did not get a chance to try the pool. I'd stay again. You are in Chicago, so expect to pay $$$ for parking!

Reviews.Title: “nine stories with a great breakfast on M-F”
Reviews.Author: Tom47494
Reviews.Content: Stayed here four nights. Next to a bus stop, one block from El. Starbucks across the street, restuarants nearby but close after 7 PM and on most of weekends. Walgreen's down the block. Beware of hotel's suggestion about nearby parking--$36 per night. Others one block away $30 per night. Taxes will amount to $30 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: JohnFoley47
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at this hotel. Staff were helpful and relatively friendly, breakfast was very good and our room was very comfortable. Not too far from the downtown area, it can be walked in about 20 mins or there is easy transport within a block or two. Would stay there again . . and Chicago was great!

Reviews.Title: “good choice in downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: LuciaGrosner
Reviews.Content: Helpful staff, comfortable room, close to everything, well priced. I'm a senior travelling solo, but I felt safe walking to and from the hotel, even in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy Ventilation”
Reviews.Author: jmchin
Reviews.Content: First night, we stayed in a room with noisy ventilation (apparently for fire regulation). We couldn't get much sleep. However, the hotel was accommodating in changing room for the next night.

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT WAY TO TREAT YOURSELF :)”
Reviews.Author: jesswell1412
Reviews.Content: I found this location to be one of the best in reference to the Laquinta Inns and Suites chain. I came in to this location just for leisure for myself. The room type I had chosen to go with was the Executive King w/Panoramic View. Gorgeous!!! The view was excellent as well as all the amenities that came with it. I have to say, that if you are looking for a great room to treat either your significant other, family- or as I did, myself- then this is by far a great option. The room was very organized and well decorated from the door all the way through. The breakfast was decent. SN: If one may not want what the hotel serves during the morning hours, there are other eating locations right down the way. I am definitely going back within the next few weeks just to enjoy the great location! -Jess

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended if you want to stay in the loop!”
Reviews.Author: elseesea
Reviews.Content: If I'm ever staying in the loop again, I'd stay here. Clean. Affordable and great value for being in the loop. Easy parking ($$), with free 15 minute off-street loading zone. Great breakfast. Free wired and wireless Internet. Friendly and helpful staff. We had room with 2-beds, and we asked for crib, fridge, and microwave, and they gave it all to us, with no extra charge! No fancy architecture or decorations. Everything works. Swimming pool (small). And clean. Easy to walk anywhere in the loop. Feels safe and secure. Relatively quiet for being two blocks from Metra station. Gym (but we didn't use it). And clean. And your usual amenities, including ice, vending machines, guest self-serve laundry. Oh, and clean. Only downsides: Room is cramped, but do-able (we had two adults, 1 toddler, and 1 infant).

Reviews.Title: “Value for the price!”
Reviews.Author: beagle77
Reviews.Content: Was in town for one night stay had a very early flight arrival and the friendly desk staff had a room available for us at 8:00am! Great location easy walk to Mellenium park. Large room clean Free wifi. Did not eat free breakfast or use pool or exercise room during my stay.

Reviews.Title: “New Hotel and great place to stay downtown”
Reviews.Author: AU046
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights for business and my conference was 3 blocks away. I could not have asked for a better hotel for my top 3 concerns: Clean, Price, and Location. I would stay here again even for pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Some Issues, But Melissa Made it Right”
Reviews.Author: justjayce
Reviews.Content: Got in really late for my first night in this hotel due to delayed flights. Ended up getting room 616 - which was extremely narrow with a double bed. There was an electrical panel on the ceiling that hummed all night and the room being located directly across from the elevator ensured that I heard the "DING DING DING" of the elevator in the morning when I was trying to catch up on my sleep. After my workday I returned to the hotel and met Melissa at the front desk, I explained my situation and she without hesitation moved me to room 604. She also made a note to make sure that the electrical panel in room 616 was looked at. Room 604 is excellent with a king bed, a worktable along the wall that spans the whole wall and a nice glassed in shower. The closet in this room, as well as the other room I was in, is small but can handle a couple of days worth of shirts. There are plenty of drawers and other storage space in the room to handle other belongings. The TV has plenty of channels and there is a mini- refrigerator and small microwave in the room. About the only thing I wish they had was a lamp on the table with an electrical socket in the base. All the electrical sockets are under the table. Bring your swim trunks because there is a pool and hot tub available. I have not had the breakfast here. Overall I am very happy with my stay now that I am in room 604.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: SwedeAbroad
Reviews.Content: Location: I was in Chicago for a conference and do not know whether the location is good for sightseeing etc. There is an El stop nearby and there are also restaurants etc. nearby. Check-in: fast, friendly and efficient. Room: the room I stayed in was very large with a very large bathroom. There was good work space and the free wireless Internet was fast and reliable. The TV was a flat screen HD TV with quite a few channels. The room was very clean and the bed was comfortable. The only minor negative is that the housekeeping staff I encountered seemed a bit 'work shy' as I was asked whether it was okay if they did not clean my room one of the days (out of four night stay) because they wanted to "leave early today". Breakfast: the free breakfast buffet was good. There was a selection of bagels, toast, cereal, pancakes, bacon, scrambled eggs, fruit salad etc. Over all: it's a good hotel and I got a competitive rate from Hotwire.com ($113/night). The lobby area is pleasant enough and the business center is very convenient if you need a printer. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with good access to public transportation.”
Reviews.Author: Wyotraveler33
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at the LaQuinta Inn and Suites Downtown Chicago, as it looked like it was a fairly new hotel and I was able to get a good package deal with airfare and show tickets. This property indeed was fairly new with rooms that featured a 70s like orange and brown color scheme, but so much, so that you thought you were back in the 70s. Our room had two double beds, a flat screen TV, desk with office chair, large closet, and Keurig Coffee Maker. Our room also had a large bathroom with walk-in shower that made me think that we got a handicap accessible room. I very much liked the shower, although some might prefer a tub/shower combination. While the bathroom was oversized it kind of took away from the size of the living area in the room, but not to the point that the room was cramped. The hotel itself offered a large free breakfast with homemade waffles, cereal, eggs, sausage, and much more. Just note the breakfast bar closes down promptly at 9 on weekdays and on weekends it is very busy, due to all of the families that stay at the hotel then. The staff at the breakfast bar was very friendly and made me feel very welcomed in morning. In addition the hotel also had a nice heated pool and small hot tub. As far as location this hotel may not have been on the â€œMagnificent Mileâ€�, but was with in walking distance of the shops on State Street. Also this hotel was close to a few small stores like Walgreens and eateries including those in a nice food court a few blocks away. Just note that many of these places close early and some close even earlier on the weekend or are not even open at all then. In addition this hotel was very close to public transportation including the L-train (one block away) and CTA buses, as well as the Metra (it was so close we walked there with luggage to catch a train) and Amtrak Train Stations. In conclusion I would recommend this hotel highly, based on my experiences. Just donâ€™t book this hotel if are looking for something in a prime location, but do book if you are looking for a clean property at a budget price and are okay with walking and/or using public transportation to get to elsewhere in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a family/tourist trip to Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Vharriet
Reviews.Content: The hotel was wonderful. We came in On the megabus. It was in walking distance to great locations--Willis tour, union station, cook-Daley civic plaza, etc. It's also very easy to get to get to a lot of good CTA bus and train locations. The breakfast was great for what it was--quick and included in the rate. They had fruit, oatmeal, waffles, sausage, bacon, eggs and juice when we were there. My cellphone got poor reception on our room, but was fine in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern, good location, breakfast”
Reviews.Author: CliveWoodrow
Reviews.Content: Fairly new hotel. Room was very clean, bright and spacious as was the hotel itself. Had breakfast both mornings and it was very good. Standard fair, for hotel breakfasts. Would go back and pay my $130 vs the $300 for others around the corner. Good value in downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “A most friendly welcome”
Reviews.Author: shri420
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent four nights here. We chose the LaQuinta for its location--namely just one block from the Civic Opera House. And on a cold, snowy night--that short walk was most welcome. The hotel is also fairly close to Union Station, and--about a $6-7 cab ride from Michigan Avenue--Art Institute and about $10 to the Field Museum. What we found to be most outstanding about our stay was the friendliness of the staff. They were cordial in all transactions; when rain appeared, they loaned us umbrellas; on Sunday morning there were no newspapers for sale at the hotel and the coin boxes were, perhaps frozen--wouldn't work. The afternoon bellman/porter Dave, offered to walk to a two block away pharmacy to get me a paper. He refused my offer of the $2 cost at which point I told him no. But an hour later, he came to our door and offered us his own copy of the paper which he had read before going on duty! The entire staff seemed pleased that we were visiting. The room (8th floor) was clean and quiet. I agree with a previous poster that privacy is to be had only with the blackout curtains, but there were seven lamps in the room and it seemed very bright. The weather was cold--but the room temp was comfortable. The room appointments were nice, although a second chair would have been useful--there was a sort of sofa however. The bed was extremely comfortable--firm and sujpportive but not rock hard. The bed coverings were folded back in an unsual way and we had to master making the best use of them. The bathroom was clean and bright--no tub (if you want a tub check with the desk, I think they may have some rooms with them, but not sure)--an easy walkin shower. Ample hot water and good towels. The wifi service was superior and it was free. We did not use the swimming pool or hottub nor did we use the laundry. As to breakfast, the current hours are 6 to 9 Weekdays and 7 to 10 Sundays. Hot scrambled eggs and bacon and sausage are on offer, plus three 'cook your own' waffle machines; hot oatmeal, three cold cereals, toast, English Muffins, bagels; juice and a mixed fresh fruit. We tried to arrive at least an hour before closing because in the final hour very little is replenished. Also, the hotel is clearly family-friendly and on the weekends after 9 it can get a little hectic. Sharing tables is ok--remember there are no strangers, just friends who have not met yet. But at closing time, the staff do clear things pdq. If you are late and need a food fix, there is a Dunkin Donuts shop about five doors east on Madison. OK, so the location is really good for the west side of the Loop, and not ideal for the near North Side or State street, but State is only five blocks east, and taxis and/or the CTA buses (buy passes at he Walgreen store 1 block east on Madison) will give you access to most everything. It wouldn't be a bad location for events at United Center. So, all in all is is a good establishment so long as you realize that it is not the Ritz; the free breakfast is a clincher for budget travellers, and in the end, the staff are the real asset.

Reviews.Title: “Would have rated this a "5" if it wasn't for a breakfast issue.”
Reviews.Author: phil521
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with just about everything. The rooms were clean and quiet with comfortable beds, the staff was exceptionally courteous, and the location was OK if you didn't mind walking 3 to 4 extra blocks to get to your destination. For us, a visit to Chicago is an opportunity to get some needed exercise, so the location was fine. We were disappointed to find that the bathroom contained only a shower, but the front desk moved us to a room with a tub. The free breakfast, while it was good and included enough choices, was an area where we were disapponted. Breakfast is served between 7 and 9 AM, but on the one morning we arrived at 8:50, much of the food was gone - no bacon for example. We began eating, hoping that someone would show up with more food. At precisely 9 AM two staff members appeared while we were in line a second time. Unfortunately, they didn't replenish the empty bacon pan as we had hoped. As I approached the pan of sausage, they removed it and ALL the remaining food as switftly as they possibly could, leaving us and the other people in line bewildered and annoyed. Even the coffee was removed! To add insult to injury, they started turning out the lights a few minutes later. Curiously, the still-sizzling but quite emply bacon pan was not removed. We expect that an establishment will stop replenishing food at the stated end time of the breakfast. But to practically snatch it out of their guests' hands at shut the lights off a few minutes later was downright rude.

Reviews.Title: “Good overall.”
Reviews.Author: cooldude2003us
Reviews.Content: I stayed up at La Quinta Inn for one night, and i enjoyed it most of the time. There are two things that I would say that could have been better. The first one is that the room was really small. The second thing is regarding breakfast, that breakfast on weekends start at 7, and it was hard for me to get to that, since my train departed around 7:30. I would stay here if i come back up to chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: LIDietitian
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal on one of the executive king with panoramic views. The room was huge and really clean. One of my friends did stay in the regular rooms with double beds and my room was about three times the size as her room. Walking distance to the bean and museums. Overall was really happy with hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous updates, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: melshere23
Reviews.Content: My husband and 1 year old son stayed at La Quinta for the Chicago Marathon. Although busy, the staff was very friendly. Additionally we were given late check-out so we could shower/rest after the race. The breakfast was adequate, typical continental. The rooms were nicely decorated and comfortable. We had room for my sons pack n play, but it was tight. They transferred a microwave and fridge into our double bed room to accommodate my request for the needs of my child. The LCD TV was flat screen; they even had HBO, multiple channels! My only gripe is the parking. We got the ticket validated at the hotel but it doesn't end up saving you any money; just the typical garage rates. But overall, they surpassed my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: 732grl
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Chicago for baseball, Cubs vs Giants. After an exhaustive search chose the La Quinta for both location and cost. We were not disappointed. Clean modern rooms, breakfast buffet and business center all exceeded our expectations for mid-level chain hotel. Public transportation is readily assessable and the hotel is within walking distance to most sights within the downtown loop. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: BlissSi
Reviews.Content: I went to a class at Training Connection. They recommended a different hotel but my colleague and I decided to stay at the LaQuinta since it was new. It was perfect. It was close. We were prepare to do a lot of walking but it was not necessary. The staff at the hotel was wonderful. The hotel was very clean and the breakfast was fantastic. We I go back I will stay here again. The rate was reasonable for Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “LaQuinta, In the shadow of the Willis Tower”
Reviews.Author: Terri Eggeman
Reviews.Content: Stayed at LaQuinta Downtown while visiting family. There was a convention in town that weekend and the rates for hotels in The Loop were averaging over 350/night. I booked for 239/night and was not expecting much. I was pleasantly surprised. I had a very spacious , king room with a microwave and mini refrigerator as well as coffee maker in room . Large desk area with free wifi, nice flat screen TV. Nice bathroom with large shower. Basic decoration but clean. Breakfast included was heavy on carbs but adequate with waffles, cereal, toast , muffins, coffee, juice ,milk and yogurt. Argo Tea was just a door way away in the lobby and a deli was also attached to the lobby. I recommend Argo Tea. Try the spiced chai. The Willis Tower was about a block away. The hotel was a block away from the river and well located with several resturants in close proximity, including the Billy Goat Tavern. This was a comfortable hotel with helpful staff .

Reviews.Title: “New Chicago hotel with great rates and an excellent breakfast included”
Reviews.Author: chaslin19
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a hotel near Union Station and discovered this new La Quinta just 5 or 6 blocks away (2 blocks from Sears Tower). You could walk it but with luggage, it is only a $5 taxi ride. The hotel and rooms are very contemporary with a full wall of desk and free internet for business travellers. Each room also has a microwave, small frig and coffee maker. The rooms all have flat screen TV's. We did notice that the HVAC was a little loud. We had a non smoking room and never smelled any smoke. The free breakfast was great with scrambled eggs, sausage and bacon as well as cereals, an assortment of pastries and bagels and fruit. There was also a waffle station and cold juices as well as teas and coffee. We got a great AARP rate for under $200. One puzzling thing was when I tried to book another night on line, the site said that the hotel was full, but when I checked after we had checked in the first night, the front desk said that there were rooms available. So I would recommend calling the hotel directly if the internet site says 'No vacancy.'

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: bbbqplayer
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a weekend vacation. Rooms were clean. The front desk staff for the most part were friendly and helpful. The hotel is located in an excellent location. Close to many area attractions such as the Willis Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, clean room in good location”
Reviews.Author: PegEggHead
Reviews.Content: As all hotels are pricey in downtown Chicago I thought this was a fair deal for the price. Check in was quick and easy. Contemporary art work in lobby and rooms. My room was on the 7th floor right next to the elevator. I am not the greatest of sleepers at hotels, but with the vent/fan running constantly, I did not hear any noises outside my room. And the room darkening curtains made for a good night's sleep. Room was large with long countertop with 2 desk chairs for spreading out computer, paper, phones, files, etc. Big bathroom with tall, all glass shower made for a fresh start in the morning. I did not eat the breakfast here so I cannot comment it. Breakfast area is on the 2nd floor and I did not even go there. I did use the computer printer in the 24/7 business center and used the adequate on premise gym, both located on the LL. Nice stay, walked almost everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “What a disapointment the 3rd time around!”
Reviews.Author: drose240
Reviews.Content: This is my review after I stayed here again and the e-mail I sent to this hotel with no response.I'm not sure if it was you who I spoke to when I checked out.(I was talking to one of the managers)I had to call the front desk 2 times Friday night of my stay.The people in room 903(I was in room 901) had there door open most of the night until 3:30 a.m and they were yelling and screaming at each other.They were also slamming the door many times.There were many people in that party and I also found out that room 902 which was across from me was also in that same party.I requested room 901 2 months prior to my stay because we had been here in June.The female manager helped me have this reservation.I am very disappointed that you would put a loud large party in front and on the side of me.I finally got to bed at 3:30pm to be woke back up around 7:30 am with them yelling and screaming again.To be honest with you,I love coming to Chicago but I am going to think twice about coming to your hotel.I recommended your hotel many times in the past and even wrote a review on trip advisor.That will change.I was told security came up and that around 10 am a manager would call my room to check if everything was o.k. and that didn't happen! I don't think I can take a chance again and have part of my trip ruined again by staying at your hotel. I didn't mention the shower smelled like urine and the shower door handle was broke. I contacted my bank about a refusal to pay this bill but unfortuantly the bill had already been processed.If this is how they care about their guests,I will find another hotel to give my money to!

Reviews.Title: “The best hidden secret in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: chrismig23
Reviews.Content: I've just returned home from a great trip to the windy city! I took 34 teenagers and 3 coworkers on a fun trip to Chicago. From the moment I decided to book this hotel I knew it was the right choice. The sales department handles emails promptly, responds questions, and accommodates your needs as much as possible. We flew in to Midway, took the "L" and got off a block and a half from the hotel. Everyone at the hotel has a friendly, service oriented attitude. It shows that they love what they do and the city!. I can't think of any single employee who is not friendly, prompt to help and smiling at the same time. Rooms are decorated with good taste! Rather modern. They offer a great breakfast! and you are just blocks away from everything. Definitely, a great choice at a reasonable price in Chicago! You won't regret staying here!

Reviews.Title: “BEST PLACE WE'VE EVER STAYED!”
Reviews.Author: CarolWinston_Salem
Reviews.Content: My husband, son and daughter-in-law recently stayed four nights here and EVERYTHING was just great! We flew into Midway, caught the EL in and walked 1 1/2 blocks to the hotel. We were guided each time out to what was the fastest/easiest way to either bus, train or told to take a taxi by the hotel staff. We loved every minute of our stay. The ONLY snafu was the outside flags mounted to the window of the room during a really windy time around 3-4am kept banging. Everything was clean, neat and the folks were super, super nice!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: kjh5475
Reviews.Content: I was in Chicago for a work conference and stayed at the La Quinta Downtown from 9/8/10 - 9/11/10. I'll admit that I chose the hotel based mainly on the price, but I was pleasantly surprised with the size of the room and with the fact that it had a mini-fridge and microwave. The view wasn't the greatest (unless you like to watch office workers at their desks) but unlike some people I don't see the appeal of sitting in a hotel room staring out the window. I thought the privacy shades were great since they blocked out the morning sun very well so I could sleep in a bit, and also, I'm a Portlander and we don't do too well with blinding sunlight. The bed was comfortable and the room was pretty quiet except for the occasional slamming door.... Of course it's not the hotel's fault that some guests are too stupid to know how to properly close a door. All in all it was a very pleasant stay and I would definitely book a room here again as long as the price is right. Details: Room = 722 Rate = $143 per night (I used a coupon code I found online to reduce the rate by 10% from $157) Amenities = Free Wi-fi, Work area, Mini Fridge, Microwave, Hair Dryer, Free Breakfast, Business Center, Fitness Center, Pool

Reviews.Title: “La Quinta Downtown, Chicago - clean, quiet, safe - a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: pope2001
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed @ the La Quinta Inn & Suites Chicago Downtown, Chicago, Illinois. The hotel is located about 4 short blocks from the Washington/Wells subway station. The hotel is centrally located in a safe area. A 15 minute walk to all the sightseeing areas on Micihgan Ave/ grant park area. The rooms are spacious, clean, and have LCD flat screen TV's, and a comfortable bed. Breakfast is included every morning. The staff is very professional and friendly. I would stay here again, an defiantly would recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “The La Quinta and the Best Staff!!”
Reviews.Author: Snowbird1986
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at the new La Quinta Inn in downtown Chicago and could not be happier with the hotel and the staff. The location is minutes from everything downtown and the staff go out of their way to make sure your stay is perfect. Our room was large, clean and well laid out. Out mattress was very comfortable and the free breakfast was complete with eggs, bacon, sausage and fresh waffles...wonderful!!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, new hotel”
Reviews.Author: chr_8
Reviews.Content: We were here for business and asked for a quiet room at check- in and that is what we were given. The hotel is fairly new and the decor pleasant. A big plus is that an Argo Tea is attached to the hotel. The pool is minute. We were given an inside room which was very quiet and we got a good night's sleep. The downside was that there is no view except into the other rooms across the way. Of course, they also have a good view into your room so for privacy's sake it is necessary to keep the shade down making it very dark indeed inside the room. The included breakfast provided enough choices that almost everyone can find something. On the negative side, the wood bathroom floor was sticky which for me is a big yuck factor. I hoped it was due to using a swifter or some such thing to clean it. The sign on the bed had the Spanish side up and the English side facing down. Obviously here mangement does not care. No one asked me at checkout how my stay was. When I called the manager later in the day I got no response and when I took the La Quinta survey I also heard nothing. For the exact dollar amount (parking included) you can stay at an historic hotel (which I can't judge because I have not stayed there) much closer to Millenium Park, the Art Institute, State St, etc. Next time I will try it.

Reviews.Title: “Going downhill fast”
Reviews.Author: melkmail
Reviews.Content: When this fairly new hotel first opened, it was a bargain compared to the luxury properties nearby. Now fast forward several months later, and the weekday price for this property is often higher than downtown hotels that understand the concept of "service". My most recent two trips were fraught with problems of being overbilled (at which point I had to be the one to present my original emails to prove the original rate - why is it always the CUSTOMER who has the onus of proof and has to do the work), and a housekeeping department that doesn't come on the days you need them to, but on the day of checkout when you supposedly have a late checkout "in the system" will barge right in regardless. Standing in the middle of dressing in the middle of my room, I would have nonetheless had the housekeeping SUPERVISOR (it would be almost excusable for a housekeeper, but absolutely inexcusable for the supervisor who is supposed to coordinate late checkout info with the front desk who's cleared it a day ahead of time) standing in front of me seeing me in my natural state had I not had the presence of mind based on countless previous experiences of exactly the same nature to put the bolt on the door every time I shut it. She tried to barge into my room after I had first had the general manager, Gary, tell me over 24 hours prior that a late checkout was ok. She tried to barge into my room after I had, secondly, looked the housekeeper in the hallway early in the day and said "you do know I'm leaving at 2 (and held up two fingers for a visual just to make it complete), right?" While I was looking through the gap in the door disbelieving that it was actually happening despite taking every step I could possibly take to assure it wouldn't, she told me that she just basically opens every door after noon whether there's a DND in it or not (the DND sign was in my door as well). So much for having a late checkout "approved" or "in the system". Not long after I heard one of the the housekeeping staff's radios uttering someone (a male on staff) saying "so all she had to do was close the door - what's the problem?" Clearly the staff of La Quinta thinks it's "no problem" to barge in a door while the occupant is very possibly not wearing a stitch of clothing, because despite the sign on the door saying "do not disturb", that's not "disturbing". What's the problem? Apparently Gary, the general manager, doesn't have one, as despite my MULTIPLE problems with the ongoing problems of this nature with his property, he's decided that his problem is the guest, not the property. Apparently he doesn't think that the entire mindset of "so what" on the part of his staff is all that important, despite the fact that there were over half a dozen true luxury hotels in the immediate vicinity charging less for a night's stay than the LQ - I stupidly chose to stay again out of some misguided "loyalty" and in thinking that a different manager's assurances on my last stay that next time "their" mistakes would be corrected meant something. Apparently the glaring mistakes made by the staff aren't the problem at all. It's that people who expect their room to be cleaned without hours passing by and multiple calls needing to be made, or people who expect to be charged what their CONFIRMATION emails stated to begin with, or people who expect "late checkout" to be something that actually means something other than getting barged in on EACH AND EVERY VISIT, not on a fluke or individual occasion, might actually have the audacity to stay at their hotel. He has the mindset of deciding a hotel guest is a "chronic complainer" without ever considering that maybe, just maybe, there are CHRONIC PROBLEMS. His words on the phone to me were that "when a guest chronically has problems with the staff, eventually we decide enough is enough" and mentioned that I was always negative with the staff. Was I negative when I very nicely asked about a late checkout the day before? Well, no actually you were pretty nice at that point. Okay then, was I negative when I looked at the housekeeper in the hallway and reminded them that I had a late checkout? Well, no, you were pretty nice then as well. Was I negative when despite doing all that the housekeeping supervisor tried to barge into my room anyway? Yes! See, that's the problem! We can't have people like you in our hotel being nice before a problem occurs and then not so nice after it happens! That's the mindset at this hotel. How dare people expect actual consistency from what one person on staff says to what another person on staff does (not a particularly big hotel or staff)? Can't have that. If you expect those kind of basics, stay somewhere else. I've logged many weeks cumulatively staying in this location. If you're a suburbanite who goes on very few trips and they're all of short duration, you might not notice any of these things because you're simply not in the hotel long enough to see them. But if you're someone who might actually stay with a property repeatedly and for any length of time, eventually they will reward your loyalty with everything I've mentioned above.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable/Clean Hotel in Business Center”
Reviews.Author: 1TXMom
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I were visiting Chicago for a few get-a-way days. We decided on this hotel because of the value compared to other downtown hotels. It was very quiet, clean and up to date. We stayed in a double full room and had ample room to move around. The furnishings were modern and stylish. The desk was adequate to keep our laptop on and had plenty of room to work. The bathroom was large. The closet had ample room and the bureau with the TV on it had 3 drawers and a cabinet with 2 shelves. The TV was great and had many channels to choose from. There was a 4 cup coffee pot, but no microwave or refrigerator. There was no "hotel" noise that interrupted our sleep, but since our room was located on the street side, there was city noise early in the morning on weekdays. Oddly, vending and ice machines were on every other floor, so we had vending (beverages only) on our floor, but had to go up or down 1 floor for ice. There was one snack, one beverage, and one icecream vending machine on the first floor. (Not sure if there were other snack machines elsewhere.) The business center was on the lower level and had 2 computers and a printer which came in handy to print tour information. The pool and hot tub were very small, but adequatedly served our purposes. Now to the only negative...which could be very frustrating: since we were in the business district, there were no restaurants open after about 6 p.m. in the immediate area and no hotel restaurant or room service. This was very frustrating on Saturday night, our first night in town. We had not had food on our flight and by the time we arrived at the hotel, weary and hungry, we didn't want to venture out by cab or public transportation. Thankfully, there is one Italian restaurant that is open 11 a.m. to 11 p.m. and delivers. So for $35 (including tip) we were able to have an overpriced meal of pizza and salad (no bevarages) delivered. The next night we had to do the same thing. Our third night we managed to have dinner before returning to the hotel. On the postive side, the breakfast was very good. On Sunday, there was the usual LaQuinta make your own waffles as well as cereal, toast, bagels, fresh fruit pieces, juice and coffee. On the weekdays they added fresh fruit salad, bacon, sausage patties and scrambled eggs. Lastly, shopping and sights to see are within several blocks walking distance to the hotel, as are bus and subway stops. We took advantage of the hop-on/hop-off tour bus our first full day which was a few blocks walk away and really enjoyed it. All in all, I would highly recommend this hotel, but next time we will probably research hotels nearer restaurants open in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: odemarce
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very crowded, people dogs everywhere elevators were painfully slow, and the free breakfast was more like a soup kitchen, big lineups no were to sit, and I went back 3 times with no luck. so I just gave up after awhile and went out for food.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but skip the breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: pauls_0875
Reviews.Content: The hotel is newer and the staff friendly but for the price there are better places in the loop and magnificent mile area. If you do stay, avoid the complimentary breakfast, it is very disappointing for a number of reasons- although eggs/bacon/sausage are included, they are of very poor quality. Also, for a hotel considering itself 'green' minded, you are provided with paper plates and utensils. Lastly, breakfast is only served until 9. There are far superior and cheap breakfast options within walking distance of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience and value”
Reviews.Author: Arborite_10
Reviews.Content: We spent the 4th of July weekend in Chicago. We are on a tight budget so La Quinta Inn was a great find. The hotel is brand new and everything is very clean. The rooms are enourmous for a downtown location. Our room accomadated three adults, one teenager, and one toddler comfortably. The beds were very comfortable with nice linens, not the vinyl ones typically found at cheap hotels. The bathroom was spacious enough to allow two women to get ready for a night on the town side by side! Breakfast was included and this is a huge plus. It can be expensive to eat out in Chicago so this was a wonderful bonus. It is basically a buffet style with all breakfast items including waffles, eggs, sausage, bread, fruit, juice, bagels, yogurt, cereal, etc. We even made PB&J sandwiches for the kids for lunch:) Free wireless internet was also a huge perk as we used this quite a bit to plan our days, check museum info, etc. I noticed that many of the other high-end hotels charge for this. The hotel was in a great location for us- we were in Chicago to see the museums. We walked to Grant park one morning and it took us about 30 minutes. It is only an 8 dollar cab ride there from the hotel and we did do this one day. There are few if any restaraunts that are open in the evening as this is the financial district, so you may want to find a place a little futher away (we ate at Ed Debevecs and Pizza Uno- highly recommend it). The Miracle Mile/Milenium park and Navy Pier are only a few minutes away via cab/car (maybe a $10 fare). Parking is expensive, but it is anywhere in Chicago. If you are going to Chicago and looking for a comfortable place while exploring the city, GO HERE. Another tip- if you are there to see the museums and have a museum/zoo membership to a local facility in your town, ask about museum reciprocity. We got into the Natural History Museum and the Science and Industry Museum for free with this. Also, the Aquarium offers free admission to individuals who hold a Bank of America credit/debit card. Check the dates on their website.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - very reasonable”
Reviews.Author: chirzel
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Chicago LaQuinta. The hotel has been redone recently and is new and clean. The room is very spacious. We liked the breakfast. Very convenient for walking downtown. The rate was the best deal in town! We weren't interested in using the pool but it is very small.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Comfortable Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: rthooper
Reviews.Content: Although we didn't spend a lot of time in the hotel, we found everything to be quite clean and comfortable. The desk staff were helpful, and the price was excellent for our central location. We were able to check in several hours early with no issue, and the rooms have a nice modern aesthetic.

Reviews.Title: “Good value if you book at the right time. New hotel”
Reviews.Author: FreqTravelerChick
Reviews.Content: This hotel is less than a year old and the newness is one of its best features. I've stayed there many times over the last few months. Check in usually goes fast and is friendly, except for one staff member who always seems to be put out to be having to do check in. All the other staff is wonderful. Rooms are modern and I personally love the fact that the showers are walk in with no tub, but I know that some people love hotel tubs. Desks are huge, which I really appreciate. Their is wired internet that is free and it has always worked. It is fairly slow access in the evenings, though. I've twice been assigned rooms which had no yet been cleaned -- they were still in the same shape as when the previous guest checked out. I've also found random items from previous guests in the fridges and in the bathrooms on more than half my stays. I find that sort of lack of detail a problem at the location and have mentioned it a couple of times to the front desk, but don't see much change. Speaking of cleaning, the maids here start cleaning rooms very early, even before 8AM. So be prepared and awake, as they are fairly assertive in wanting to get into your room, often waiting until you go for breakfast to swoop in. I have to leave the Do Not Disturb hang tag on my door for my entire stay to fend them off in the early hours. The breakfast is nicer that many "free breakfast' hotels, but the staff there start blocking off access about 20 minutes prior to closing and stop filling food items shortly after, even upon request. You've been warned. Arrive early and finish eating about 30 minutes before the closing time. One great thing is that they supply soy milk, which I drink. A+ for that. The coffee in the breakfast area is undrinkable, but fortunately there is a Starbucks across the street and a cafe just off the lobby. This is one of the few hotels in its class that does not supply coffee/tea throughout the day. There is a coffee maker in the room, but they do not restock the coffee during your stay. There is no bottle opener in the room and only one for the whole hotel. So come prepared. One warning - most restaurants in this area close very early, some just after lunch/work hours. I tend to work late and struggle to find anything close by to eat after 7 PM. I hear that pizza delivery or 7-Eleven is your only choice within a few blocks. Finally, parking is expensive (as it is at all downtown hotels) and if you want in and out privileges, you have to park at the hotel garage next door. However, on check out day if you stay past noon, you have to pay for two days on that last day, which amounts to $65 for parking for that day.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: JessNcity
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very clean and newly renovated. I think if you are on a budget it is a great deal. Looks to be half the cost of surrounding downtown hotels. However, I will say the bed is pretty hard at which I did not sleep well. Two other collegues said the same thing. Staff was very friendly and location was ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Great price; great location!”
Reviews.Author: GelEGuy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights with my spouse, and will definitely return. Room was *immaculately* clean and spacious, with nice amenities (comfortable desk chairs, free wireless, nice television, mini fridge and microwave, etc.) Shower was fantastic (large, with great water pressure), although I would've preferred to have had a bathtub, as well. The complimentary breakfast, while nothing to write home about, was more extensive than one might expect at a similarly priced hotel. Finally, the location is great (less than a block from the "loop"), and I doubt you can beat the price for such a clean room in downtown. The downside to the location is that, since it is in the financial district, most nearby shops and restaurants close quite early.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: sameoldg2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is sandwiched between skyscrapers in beautiful downtown Chicago. Its just a few blocks to many cultural hotspots and 2 - 4 blocks from two L stops. Location-wise, you can't ask for too much more, but be aware that there isn't much nightlife in this area. The hotel itself appears to have been recently renovated, and I was pleasantly surprised by how new and modern the interior is. The free breakfast was better than I've had at other hotels of this class, and free Wifi was a nice perk. On the downside, we found stains on the linens on both beds and placed the "please change the linens" card on both beds as instructed, but the linens were not changed. The walls are also incredibly thin - you'll hear whenever someone shuts a door or the elevator dings. For the price, this is really a great find.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location!”
Reviews.Author: DownstateChamp
Reviews.Content: My sister and I recently stayed at the hotel while visiting Chicago to see American Ballet Theatre perform at the Civic Opera House. It's been a while since we've been to Chicago and searching for a hotel in a good location and close to everything that we wanted to see and do during our short time in the city was a bit difficult at first. We finally decided to book this hotel due its proximity to the Opera House and also to Union Station. After staying at the hotel we highly recommend it for anyone traveling to Chicago, for business or pleasure. The hotel rooms look exactly like what is featured on La Quinta's website - they have been renovated and are very modern. The bathroom has hardwood flooring and a walk in shower (no tub) encased in glass. The room was a good size, not at all cramped. The beds were full size, no double queens available, but were clean and comfortable. The flat screen TV was nice but channels were limited, no HBO. The room we were in was on the Franklin street side and at night I did not notice any extreme street/city noise problems. The staff were friendly and on our check out day they let us store our bag in their luggage room while we went off shopping to Michigan Ave. The breakfast is pretty standard, not outstanding. It has the usual continental items - fruit, yogurt, cereal, milk, juice, coffee, muffins, breads & bagels, scrambled eggs, sausage & bacon and waffles. We did have to go up one floor to get ice and the business center is located on the lower level which was a little disconcerting. As far as restaurants around the hotel, it is connected to Argo Tea, there's a Starbucks across the street, there's also a restaurant called Pot Belly's across the street. There's also a cafe that's connected to the hotel but I can't remember the name of it. There's a Jimmy John's Deli and a Dunkin' Donuts around the corner. Unfortunately a lot of these places were closed after our event, which ended around 10 pm. We took a cab to Water Tower Place on Michigan Ave and the fare was around $10 not including a tip. We felt comfortable walking to the Civic Opera House and also to Union Station to catch our train home. The area is well populated during the day with business people and tourists alike. The one recommendation I can make is to improve the doors to the rooms. They looked like they were steel doors but they didn't feel as secure as I would have liked. As a person who is also employed in the hospitality industry (I work in hotel sales), I came into the hotel with a critical eye and I was pleasantly surprised by the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend getaway with friends”
Reviews.Author: cummins10_4
