Reviews.Content: This hotel was awesome....it was located right downtown...hence the name chicago downtown....it was right next to the parking garage which was 72.00 to park for the two days and just a block away from the Willis (sears) tower...there was 4 of us all together and we split the cost of the room, the only bad thing about it was the double bed rooms were really only double beds so it was a close sleep...on other reviews i seen they had glass stand up showers, we were placed in a handicap room so we had a bathtub and shower..the bathroom was huge which was great they had hardwood floor in the entry way and the bathroom...flat screen tv, a computer desk with a very comfortable chair....huge window over looking the city...the hotel staff was very friendly and helpful giving us directions and recommendations on where to go eat and travel throughout the city....which we bought a 1 day pass to travel on the bus or the train for 5.75...what a great deal...we didnt go to the pool but we did look in on it and it is a very small hot tub and pool..the morning breakfast was really good but it was kind of a poor set up there were long lines for everything and there wasnt very many places to sit down...they also had pop machines on the first second and fifth floors, the last day i was ill and wanted a sprite my husband had to go to each one just to find one...finally the last one he went to he found sprite which took his money, the front desk did give him his money back and he was able to get me a sprite...the one thing about the city we didnt like was everything seemed to close early, a lot of places closed at 5 to 8pm....which im sure is because it is probably a business city and they do a lot of monday-friday 9-5 sort of thing...other then that it was a great weekend...

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good location, great value”
Reviews.Author: RangerDon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at La Qunita Inn in downtown Chicago this January. The hotel was newly remodeled and we found the room very clean and comfortable. The bathroom was large, clean and the shower was great. The free breakfast was outstanding. Staff was very friendly and helpful. The location is about 5 blocks from Union Station and a short walk form the lakeshore. We walked to the Art Institute of Chicago in 30 degree weather with no problem. As we came in by train, the locaton was perfect, a $6 cab ride away. No resturant in the hotel (except for breakfast) , but several in vacinity. Only down side is minor noise from the EL train, ask for the quiet side of the hotel if this is a problem . I fully recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It was as awesome experience.”
Reviews.Author: MandoviC
Reviews.Content: It's located at the heart of Chicago downtown, and very close to Sears Tower. It's very well connected to all the other parts of Chicago. People at the hotel were very helpful. The hotel is clean and very well maintained. I liked the decor of our room too. The bathrooms are quite big. They serve nice breakfast every morning, which is included in the daily room charge, which is definitely a plus point. We were very satisfied with our selection. We would like to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nearly Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Gl0bal_Biz_Traveler
Reviews.Content: This is a new hotel and it looks and feels that way. It is very clean and has a nice modern theme. I was in Chicago for work so I chose a place close to where I needed to be so La Quinta's Inn location was nearly perfect. The downside of the La Quinta Inn location is that there are no restaurants open later in the evening within a short distance of the hotel. When I checked in at 10 PM the first night, I asked for a place to eat nearby. They suggested a 7-11. Seriously! The only continental breakfast was just fine - nothing fancy, but nothing horrible either. The rooms were pretty quiet however I could always hear the neighboring room open and close the blinds. Very odd!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay, the rooms were clean, and the staff was helpful!”
Reviews.Author: pa55p0rttrave1er
Reviews.Content: Not our first choice, but all our other choices were booked, I guess there was a convention or something going on. We were very pleasently suprised, the rooms were spacious, and clean. The shower door had a severe leak, and the bathroom floor was quite wet after a shower. other ameneties we used, and were please with included: a business center, and the fitness room (very nice machines, but few) Check out was proir to our train reservation, but the bellman stored our luggage while we took in some Chicago sites. The front desk staff was quite helpful with many suggestions to fill up our day of site seeing, as well as a great dinner suggestion. Dinner was at Lloyds Steakhouse; just a block away. Overall a exceptional stay!! Thanks!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: packerbacker43
Reviews.Content: Room was clean, front desk personel superb, pool very small and hot tub only held 2 people, breakfast was awsome for being continental, only downfall was too far to magnificent mile, had too walk too far. And don't take advice from strangers they charge.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: 1BigDaddy1
Reviews.Content: The favorable reviews, free WiFi, free breakfast, pool, location, and discounted parking was the reason I decided to stay at this hotel. I booked the standard room with 2 Full beds. At check-in, the friendly receptionist upgraded us an Executive room with King bed and pullout sofa. The room was a very spacious corner room on the top floor with 2 walls of windows for an impressive view of the surrounding city. The bathroom was large and modern. The deskspace was 10 feet long with 2 leather executive chairs. Just a great experience. Everything in the hotel is new and modern. The only downside is the pool and hottub are really small! But the kids had fun, and it didn't matter. Everything else was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “HIGHLY RECOMMEND STAYING HERE”
Reviews.Author: Traveljunkie037
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in Nov. and will definetly return. The hotel is spotless, has a great location, and very up-to-date. Not to mention that the front desk staff were some of the nicest, most helpful people we encountered on our trip. For the room, we could not have been more satisfied with the cleanliness and amenities. The beds were comfy, shower was spacious and modern, and the TV's were awesome (not the tiny ones seen at many hotels). Overall great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: carol41363
Reviews.Content: My work booked this hotel due to the fact that it is basically across the street from our corporate office. The hotel was easy to find, in great location, and the people were wonderful. The view from my 5th floor room was of other windows and covered parking - would have like to see some of the sights. My only real complaint is that I needed a refrigerator for my medication. Most hotels all feature mini fridge/microwave. This hotel did not have a mini-fridge. And since the room was paid for by someone else, I could not add one. It turned out not to be too big of a deal as I filled the ice bucket up with ice and kept my medication on it all night but I had no way of refreezing my ice packs to keep in my bag. That being my only issue, I would definately stay here again as the proximity to the "EL" and office can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay but the Loop is dead in the evenings”
Reviews.Author: etacar11
Reviews.Content: The location is great for sightseeing in the downtown area of Chicago. 2 blocks from the Sears Tower, an easy walk to the Art Institute. We hardly even used the subway. BUT the Loop, with the exception of the Theatre District, is dead for the most part in the evenings. Since it's not a very residential area, most of the stores and restaurants shut down. We were there Friday to Sunday, not sure if this holds true all week, though. The hotel itself was very comfortable, the room was spacious. In fact, it was a little empty; they could have easily added a nice couch to ours. A long desk under the window was great for setting up my laptop (the free wifi was effortlessly easy to use). The staff was very nice and helpful (even if they didn't have any stamps for my postcards). The free breakfast spread was outstanding (though I wish they had skim milk and other fat-free stuff). Business and fitness centers were easily accessible in the basement. My one big complaint about the room was that it had a shower stall but no tub. I prefer a tub for a nice bath. I can live without it, but the shower in this case leaked all over the bathroom floor. Bad design. Quit trying to be so "modern".

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value in the Loop”
Reviews.Author: mipo777
Reviews.Content: This new hotel had a great location 1 block for the Sears Tower, a hot breakfast with eggs and waffle maker, great flatscreens with actuall High Def signal. The only negative is a pool and hot tub the size of a bathtub but man it was a great value. Will be back

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience!”
Reviews.Author: rlj1280
Reviews.Content: This was the best price I could find in the downtown area of Chicago. It was my first trip there so I was a little nervous about how this hotel would be. If I come back to Chicago ( I hope to soon), I will absolutely stay here again. The rooms were nice and very clean. The breakfast was great and FREE and the location was perfect. The most memorable part was that after we arrived, we recieved a phone call in the room to ensure we had everything we needed. I don't think any hotel has ever done that before!

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was the perfect location, price, and amenities”
Reviews.Author: bawomin
Reviews.Content: We always try to stay at La Quinta Inn & Suites. We find them to be very clean with the right price. The Chicago downtown location was no exception, plus it was modern, accommodating, and located close to the trains and attractions we were interested in. I know we will stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “I will defiently be back!”
Reviews.Author: drose240
Reviews.Content: September 05, 2009 This was the first time I was in Chicago.This was a very good experience.We got there before check in and they let us get into the room early.If we weren't able to they would allow you to store your luggage in a locked room before and after check out.The room was clean.The beds were comfortable.It has a large screen TV with HBO.The bathroom had a coffee pot,coffee,cream,sugar and cups.The ice machine was close by with reasonable priced pop.The closet had a iron and ironing board.It also stated that if you didn't remember to bring you razor,toothbrush,toothpaste etc..they could provide it for you.The pool and whirlpool was inside and clean and with towels.The free breakfast was outstanding.It had homemade waffles,scrambled eggs,bacon,sausage,muffins,bagels,yogurt,fruit,coffee,cereal,tea and juices.The shower head had many settings and they provided shampoo and soap.It had a desk and chair in the room with free internet hookup.I was also very impressed on how nice the workers treated you.I felt it was necessary to let someone know. Pros: Swimming pool,whirl pool,free awesome breakfast Cons: Couldn't stay longer!

Reviews.Title: “La Quinta downtown”
Reviews.Author: rvsherry
Reviews.Content: Just spent two nights at the new La Quinta at Madison and Franklin. Whatta bargain! Rooms were spotless; staff was cordial and helpful; breakfast was in a spacious, light room with a large assortment of hot and cold food. It is 2-4 blocks from Union Station and so convenient. An easy walk to the Art Museum, Millinneum Park and the Magnificent Mile. Be sure to look into Chicago greeter program from the Cultural Center..a great addition to our tripl Our total bill was $257 for two nights with breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the price”
Reviews.Author: QMB
Reviews.Content: The La Quinta was very clean and very secure. Called out for food late at night and the security person wouldn't let the delivery person up without first calling me. The breakfast is outstanding. The room was beautiful and fairly large. I didn't notice any late night noise and the bed was very comfortable. This motel is one block from the Sears Tower (can't remember the new name). Very convenient location. Parking is $$, but I think that is standard in downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price.”
Reviews.Author: Alan1967
Reviews.Content: The hot tub wasn't very clean and the hot tub and pool are tiny. The breakfast was good. The room was clean. You are better off staying outside of Downtown and taking public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel - very clean and new - excellent service”
Reviews.Author: APip
Reviews.Content: The minute I walked in the doors I knew this was a great , clean hotel..Rooms are very Contemporary, beautiful bathrooms and very comfortable king size beds..It is a 5 minute cab ride to the Magnificent mile ( although you could walk , it could take a while) , You can see the Sears tower from your room. I loved that they provided a complimentary breakfast in the morning , swimming pool, exercise room and computer access. The only thing I did not like was you have to pay for parking ( around $30/day) Other than that this place is awesome for a business or leisure trip to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great location / room / breakfast - excellent!”
Reviews.Author: mich1542
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night but wish it could have been longer. we were en route to Montana and booked this hotel online. Very central location, short walk to Sears tower etc. Room was great - clean and spacious. Unusually for the USA breakfast was included - also very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Fair Price, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: doormold
Reviews.Content: I spent one night here, while in Chicago for a business trip. I believe the hotel just recently opened, so everything seemed pretty new. The check in was quick and easy, and Leo the doorman was very friendly. My room was clean and comfortable, especially the bed. I loved the FREE wireless internet service (nowadays, far too many hotels gouge for that) and the FREE breakfast was more than sufficient. I had dinner with an old high school buddy, so I canâ€™t speak to the restaurants, but Starbucks and Dunkinâ€™ Donuts were in close proximity. The best thing about the hotel? My room rate was $116/night, which is pretty hard to find in downtown Chicago! The hotel was an easy train ride from Midway (at $5.50 round trip, why take a cab?) and the walk from the El, depending upon which station you exit, was just a block or two. The only flaw was my failure to ask for an â€œinsideâ€� room. Chicago is an all night town and the street noise was a little irritating for this fairly light sleeper. Overall, a good stay and I would not hesitate to return to this La Quinta.

Reviews.Title: “La Quinta Chicago Downtown Money suckers.”
Reviews.Author: JKS2009
Reviews.Content: I checked in this hotel late on 11:00 PM the usual check-in time is 3:00PM.When I checked in I have told the front desk that I will be checking out late which they made a note.I was told specifically that they charge for a night.Now when I see my credit card bills it seems they have charged for 2 nights.Now they are giving excuses that the late check-out cannot be so late (10:00 PM) at night.My question is they could have informed me earlier that I need to pay for an additional night.Infact I could have stayed an additional night.This is a trick to eat money as they have the credit card number to do anything.Never ever stay here.Be very cautious to stay in these type of hotels.Its better to give a penny to a beggar rather that to the money making attitude these hotels have. I have read different reviews that La Quinta is famous to snach money from the common people this way.

Reviews.Title: “Central Downtown Location 1 Block From Sears Tower”
Reviews.Author: KeepinItSimple
Reviews.Content: The pricing coupled with the newness and the location, make this a comfortable value.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice new value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tree_and_Me
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my one night stay. I was in Chicago on business and this new La Quinta gave me what I needed for a comfortable stay away from home. The hotel is very clean and the staff was attentive and friendly. I liked the wireless internet in the room which worked great and was included in the rate. I paid $113 which is excellent for a modern, good-sized room with breakfast in a very good location in downtown Chicago. I highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay there again if in town on business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “worth the price to stay dowtown.”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel1020
Reviews.Content: This hotel is definitely the least expensive in the area but paying less doesn't mean you are getting less. The rooms are super clean and have a nice art deco look. The breakfast was more than your average continental breakfast. Eveyrthing was always fresh and they never ran out of food, so there's no need to rush and get there early. The staff was friendly with us and my puppy whom I can never leave behind. The fitness center was small, but perfect for a workout. The pool, was small but also perfect for a quick dip.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay for a great price!”
Reviews.Author: dufflo
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at this brand new hotel. Amazing beds, almost sound proof rooms. The staff was very helpful and friendly. Can't beat these rates!

HotelInfo.Name: La Quinta Inn & Suites Chicago Downtown
HotelInfo.Address: 1 South Franklin, Chicago, IL 60606
